intro: Dolichothele beneckei, commonly known as the slender threadweaver, is a species of spider belonging to the family Linyphiidae. It is characterized by its elongated, slender body and long, delicate legs, which are adaptations for its web-building behavior. This spider constructs small, sheet-like webs, typically in grassy or shrubby habitats. Dolichothele beneckei is found in various parts of Europe and is often associated with moist environments. Its botanical relevance lies in its role as an indicator species for habitat quality and biodiversity in its native ecosystems.
